Components.Description: The most common way to vary the resistance in a circuit continuously is to use a rheostat. It is basically used to adjust magnitude of current in a circuit by changing length.

Components.Name: Vm
Components.Title: Voltmeter
Components.Description: A voltmeter is an instrument used for measuring electric potential difference between two points in an electric circuit. It is connected in parallel. It usually has a high resistance so that it takes negligible current from the circuit.

Components.Name: Gm
Components.Title: Galvanometer
Components.Description: An ammeter is an instrument used to measure the current in a circuit. Electric currents are measured in amperes (A). For direct measurement, the ammeter is connected in series with the circuit in which the current is to be measured.

Components.Name: R1
Components.Title: Resistor
Components.Description: A resistor is a passive two-terminal electrical component that implements electrical resistance as a circuit element. In electronic circuits, resistors are used to reduce current flow, adjust signal levels, to divide voltages, bias active elements, and terminate transmission lines, among other uses.
